content: TITLE: Using flag-icons with HTML and CSS classes DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the flag-icons CSS classes to display flag icons within HTML elements. The `.fi` class is required, and `.fi-xx` (where `xx` is the ISO 3166-1-alpha-2 code) specifies the country. The `fis` class can be added for a squared version of the flag. SOURCE: https://github.com/lipis/flag-icons/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing flag-icons CSS in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows how to import the flag-icons CSS file into a JavaScript project. This enables the usage of CSS classes to display flag icons within HTML elements. This assumes the flag-icons package is installed via npm or Yarn. SOURCE: https://github.com/lipis/flag-icons/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import "/node_modules/flag-icons/css/flag-icons.min.css"; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Linking flag-icons CSS via CDN DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to include the flag-icons CSS file in an HTML document using a Content Delivery Network (CDN). This allows for easy integration without installing the package locally. The CDN link points to a specific version of the flag-icons CSS. SOURCE: https://github.com/lipis/flag-icons/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: CSS properties for flag-icons DESCRIPTION: This CSS snippet shows the default styles applied when using flag-icons with `fib` class on any element. It includes properties to ensure the flag appears in the middle of the element with proper sizing and no repetition. SOURCE: https://github.com/lipis/flag-icons/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: css CODE: ``` background-size: contain; background-position: 50%; background-repeat: no-repeat; ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing flag-icons via npm or Yarn DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to install the flag-icons package using either npm or Yarn. It shows the commands to add the package to your project's dependencies. The package contains SVG flags and associated CSS for easy integration. SOURCE: https://github.com/lipis/flag-icons/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` npm install flag-icons # or yarn add flag-icons ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Serving flag-icons locally DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to serve the flag-icons project locally on `localhost:8000`. It uses Yarn to start a development server, allowing for local testing and development. SOURCE: https://github.com/lipis/flag-icons/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ yarn start ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building flag-icons SCSS files DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to build the SCSS files after cloning the project. It assumes Yarn is installed and used for managing project dependencies. SOURCE: https://github.com/lipis/flag-icons/blob/main/README.md#_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` $ yarn build ```
